definition: mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: This newly-built road twisted and turned across the hills.
sentences.chinese: 这条新建成的公路蜿蜓曲折地穿过群山。

sentences.english: Their arms factory lies in range of high mountains.
sentences.chinese: 他们的武器工厂坐落在群山峻岭之中。

sentences.english: A sailor and his son lived nearby mountains.
sentences.chinese: 一名海员和他的儿子住在群山附近。
有蓝岭群山，山纳多河流。

sentences.english: It took China Yida one year to construct this park, which is in the middle of rugged mountains.
sentences.chinese: 就一年时间亿达公司就在巍巍的群山中建成这个营地。

sentences.english: The mountains began to throw their long blue shadow over the valley.
sentences.chinese: 群山已开始在山谷中投下青灰色的阴影。

sentences.english: The undulating hills are rich in mineral resources.
sentences.chinese: 峰峦起伏的群山中蕴藏着丰富的矿产资源。

sentences.english: We sat before the window watching the paleness of light of dawn.
sentences.chinese: 在晨曦中，我们仅能看到群山的轮廓。

sentences.english: A clap of thunder wakes the hills.
The mountains began to throw their long blue shadows over the valley .
sentences.chinese: 群山已在山谷里开始投下蔚蓝色的长影。

sentences.english: The mountain soars to heaven aBove all rivals.
The town is in the mountains, named "mountain town".
sentences.chinese: 该城镇修建在群山之中，故取名“山城”。

sentences.english: The little village perches high among the hills.
sentences.chinese: 小村庄高踞于群山之中。

sentences.english: The road snakes (its way) through the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 那条路斗折蛇行穿过群山。

definition: the peaks of a mountain range
halfway up a mountain/lit. waist of mountain
